Entry.3:
Moved to Warminister

1.18

Went to Pioneer School at Reading
Entry.6: Left Le Havre for the Battalion
Entry.7: Went to the end of the line in mistake & finally got out at Candas. Slept there that night in old flying camp sheds
Entry.8: Left Candas at 10.30 pm & marched to Fienvillers. Got billeted
Entry.9: Went for route march thro Autheox. Only a small village.
Entry.10: Left Fienvillers & came to Ergnies. We passed thro Berneuil, Franqueville & Gorenflos. We s'uposed to stop at the latter but couldn't get billets. At this place 'Ergnies' we did fairly well. Two of us got a bed. Arrived about 3 pm & after we got settled down two of were sent up to an aerodrome. Had afty tea & met an Airs in the Corp. Have been promised a ride for tomorrow
Entry.11: No luck for flight. Was too windy. Left Ergnies & moved to Pernois. Passed thro on the way Brucombs, St Oven, & Bertedycourt. Met Dad Hetherington at Pernois
Entry.12: Left Pernois & moved to Villers Bocage. Passed thro on the way Cannaples, Haverrias & Flesselles. Kunckey & Dean caught us up.
Entry.13: Left Villers, Bocage & moved to Bussy les Daours, Passing thro. Coisy, Cardonette & Allonville. From Bussy we moved to Blangy-Tronville & joined the Battalion.
Entry.14: Left Blangy & moved to Bussy. Passed thro. Daours on the way.
Entry.15:
Worked at Aubigny

Fritz crack airman killed.
Entry.16: Went to Corbie but couldn't get a thing. Could have saved a big clock but it was too heavy.
Entry.17:
Slept in out new dug

out last night. It got a good christening as we had to stand to at 3 am. Fritz attacked at Villers Bretenneux at that time. Didn't do any work but stook to all day.
Entry.18: Started back on our work again after out stand to. Had 2 hours parade a day doing RE. PT, gas drill & BF. was goodo.
Entry.19: Went up to Villers Brettoneux & got a gas helmet, steel helmet & some bullets from some dead Fritz. Got shelled everywhere we went.
Entry.20: No 8 Platoon played the Transport Cricket. We won by 6 wickets. Made 0 first innings of the 2nd was bowled l.b.w. each time by shoots. Got 7 for about 14 in the
Entry.22: Had to go miles to out job today. Didn't get back till 3.20. Went out & had a good look at Fritz trenches. Was goodo. Started to play cricket but it started to thunder lightening & rain to some order that it has to be postponed. No bon.
Entry.23: The company moved from Bussy closer to the line. Had to dig in again. Gee it is getting monotonous. My platoon placed about
Entry.25: Had a terrible night going to work . Fritz caught my platoon as we were going to work with 2 barrages of HE & a little gas. Had 1 killed. 2 seriously wounded & 2 others wounded. All slightly gassed, but personally I think from the HE as they burst right on the trench. We got in after the first couple of shells. Went up & had a look at the other platoons. We were the only platoon caught.
Entry.26:
Sent out & buried poor Mueers. Acres I think will die. Hope not 'cos

he was a good & bright boy.
Entry.27: Capt Wilkinson was promoted to Major last night. Dates from the
Entry.28: Was shelled on the job, but no casualties.
Entry.29: Bombed & shelled all round our camp. Kept us all awake. Time we had a good sleep I think.
Entry.30: Got home early from work. Went out 8.30 pm & home at 12.30 am. Goodo. Things fairly quiet. Left our camp & came back to the battalion at Bussy. Do me. Guess we will have a sleep tonight. Very quiet here. Just heard that Appleby has died (as well as Acres) of wounds. Very bad. Am very sorry indeed. They were all good boys.
Entry.31: No work today. Drew 150 francs (£ 5/10/.) & sent £ 4/4/-over to Blighty for a course in Pelmanism.
Entry.32: Some hot, went out to work on another switch trench near Villers Brettoneux. Only took us 2 hours to get out, 4 ½ hours work & 1 ½ hours to come home. Far too hot for this work. Fritz machine shot down behind our lines. Best I've seen. Gee he came down some hitting the earth with a crash.
Entry.33: Go out on night work again. Just as well too as it is hotter today. Fritz bombed all round our camp last night.
Entry.34: My spell home tonight. Perkins took my platoon out.
Entry.35: Got shelled a bit. Had to run for my life coming home. Fritz bombed. Could hear the bomb coming. Grabbed hold of the S.B & we ran. Just as well too as it dropped only a few yards from where we were.
Entry.36:
Little bit of gas tonight. Everything OK tho.

Some bombing very near the camp.
Lt. Dick joined the
Entry.37: Plenty of bombing tonight. Much nearer than usual to our little camp. Stevenson got knocked down but wasn't too bad. Dick joined the Coy.
Entry.38: Got a York attached to the Coy for instruction. We only have 9 officers here with the Coy now. Went out on the trench digging job again & finished.
Entry.39: Had a spell all day & night. Quite a change.
Entry.40: Started making dug outs for artillery (our own).
Entry.41: York left & rejoined his Unit. He was a very decent bird. Enjoyed him. Got quite a lot of news from him. My spell tomorrow. Do me.
Entry.42: Went out on the artillery dugouts again. Had 1 casualty. 1 of Scrivens men getting wounded. Was very lucky as he kept peppering the job all day with 5 g's.
Entry.43: The platoon has a spell today. Had an inspection & our usual game of cricket. Generally have a game after we come home from work. Had a look at an armoured car & then went to Daours for a bath. Was excellent. Did me. Vi's parcel from the Daily Mail arrived. Am going to see a boxing mach tonight at Daours.
Entry.44:
The show last night was excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Platoon has another sepll today. The first three books on Pelmanism. No letter from Vi. Think I'm turned down for keeps. Fritz has been busy with his checking. Fritz cam over last night but didn;t drop a bomb. Dead lucky. The platoon played the

Transport boys cricket & we won easily – made 141 to 51. Managed to get 3 wickets & made 12. Coming on.
Entry.45: Out to work again today. Fritz was fairly busy with his shelling. No casualty today. The Officers played the NCO's & men of the battalion cricket today. We got them out for 72 (got 4 for about 16 or so) & we them out for 72 (got 4 for about 16 or so) & we only made 24 (made 1). Started reading the Pelmian books.
Entry.46: Had a bath. church parade this morning. Some stunt. Played cricket in the afty. & bowled very well again. Have done very well with the ball lately. Had a parcel of books & some writing material from Marie Fraser. Was goodo.
Entry.47: of my boys are picked for the battalion cricket team. We play the ASC on their ground tomorrow. Am also in the team.
Entry.48: Did some tactical exercises in the morning. Gee they were some mix up. We played the 29th A.S.C. cricket in the afternoon & beat them very easily. Won by an innings & 42 runs. Didn't have a hit as I went in last the other boy got bowled first ball. Got 4 for 27 tho so did fairly well with the ball.
Entry.49: More exercises today. Got inoculated just before lunch. Lt Guest & Wilson retd today. they make 10 in this coy. wrote a couple of letters in the afty & did some Pelmian. Both Guest & Wilson were sent to other coys.
Entry.50: Ill all day from inoculation. Had a terrible night. Tried to go out to work but couldn't manage it.
Entry.51: A little better today but am still fairly seedy. Went to work tho.
Entry.52:
Goodo today, altho. arm is still swollen. Started a cricket match against the 4th Div. HQ. We made 73 & 106. Made 4 & 14 & got 1 wicket in the innings for 14. Happened to get going at

right time. We had 7 down for 60 3h4n I went in – we brought it up to 90 odd. They made 51 in their innings. We finish the game tomorrow. Look in a good winning position too as we have 3 of them out for 16. Have 2 good solid bats in now tho against us.
Entry.53: Worked in the morning & finished the game in the afternoon winning by 22 runs. They made a good start. Only got 1 wicket but 2 or 3 chances were dropped. Bad luck, still as we won I let them off.
Entry.54: Another church parade today. Getting sick of this padre. He talks far too much. He is a Salvo. bird & shows it very plainly. Still I guess will get on with him alright.
Entry.55: Finished our work before 10 am. Only took us 1 ½ hours. C.O. had all officers up & gave them a little bit of news about the war. After this meeting No 8 Platoon played rest of 'B' Coy at cricket. We won by am innings & 23 runs. Actually got going this time & made 19 not out. Something unusual for me.
Entry.56: Played the D.A.C. cricket at our ground. They went thro us in the 1st innings. Only made 18. Got them out for 43 & then we made 90. I made 4 in the first innings & 0 in the second. We got them out for 57 & so we won by 8 runs. Bowled well getting 3 for 5.
Entry.57:
Bonney couldn't party tonight. The Kookooburra's gave us a turn They were excellent. The officers from HQ & A Coy played B.C & D. We got them out for 30. Both Hassell & self getting hatrick. We made 125. I made a duck. Got caught out first ball. Tried everyone bowling in the second innings & they made 135 so we only won on the first innings. They wouldn't let us bat in our second.

Officer from 2nd Pioneers came down to take our camp over. We move up the day after tomorrow to take over from them.
Entry.59:
D in the cricket 
tomorrow
 today. Scores were they 64 & we 92. I made a duck again but managed to get 2 wickets for 11 so did alright. Osborne came round to see me today.
Entry.60: Left Bussy & went to a spot near Heilly. Passed thro La Werville & Bonnay. Left camp at 6.42 am & arrived there at 10 am. Gee we had to climb 2 hills & they were beauties. Went out & had a loook at our work in the afternoon & at 10 pm had to take out a party & get a start.
Entry.61:
Rained this morning making everything slippery. This is a boring camp. Only one disadvantage & that is shortage of water. The rain didn't last long. The 
deg
 job is goods. Do me.
Entry.62: This camp is near enough. Old Fritz can see it quite plain but the trees protect us. Of course there is very little movement here now. Everything is as quiet as possible. the Tommies made a stunt on our left last night & old Fritz pushed artillery back at us. Got 14 letters today.
Entry.63: Rained some today. Kept going too nearly all day. Our little home was some slippery. Could hardly move about.
Entry.64: Finished our job, or rather finished on the job at the
Entry.65: Field Coy took over from us. We go our on the road work tomorrow. Old Fritz shelled just below our home & pieces flew across the place. Will write 'John Bull' about it all if things don't alter.
Entry.66:
Went out on the road work. It is near Heilly. After we got home we

found out that only one platoon is to keep on the road work & the rest are on CT on the front line. Going to our job was rotten, Up hills & down hills. Gee it wasn't too good.
Entry.67: Didn't go out on job tonight because of a raid by our people. We could only work for about 1 ¾ hours as they wanted to use the truck so it was a waste of time going out.
Entry.68: Boring day today. Wilsons came out & had lunch with us. Started on our job at the front line. Everything went well.
Entry.69: Got out of bed at 1 pm. Some cold today. Rained just enough to make our track to work slippery. Big clouds of mist came along & disappeared, all night. We sent over gas at Fritz just as our boys finished their task.
Entry.70: Syd Halford came along to see me this morning while I was still in bed. Had a good old talk of our Sydney days. Got my first letter from Phyl Barber. Wrote to Alec. Howlett. Fixed a new spring in out phonograph this afternoon & we played it to death for an hour or so afterwards. Real bonny day. We went to work as usual but were short of shovels so had to go round & look for some.
Entry.71:
While looking for shovels we came across some old Fritz positions. Gee they were knocked about some. Couldn't find any shovels so took Sgt Klunke up to the front line for them. While there old Fritz started putting over shells. We couldn't move as they were all round us. Eventually I stopped a lot of earth from 
the
 a shell. was too close for further damage. It burst about 2 ft away from me on the edge of the parapet & trench. Got all my face peppered. Gee it is some picture. Should

have my photo taken now. Guess it would be worth something as a picture too. Didn't go out to work tonight.
Entry.72: Had to go down to the 14th Field Ambulance today & let another Doctor have a look at my face. Very nearly sent me away but decided to have another look tomorrow. Gee it is some sight, & my eye looks real well. Am not going out to work tonight.
Entry.73:
Went to the 14th F.A. again. My face is on the improve now. My eye is swollen a bit more but is improving a treat. Wrote 5 letters this afternoon.

Syd Halford came up to see me yesterday & didn't recognise me at all.

Saw Ross this morning, also saw Palmer. Old Fritz shelled Syd Halford's camp a treat this morning. Hope he is O.K.

Lot of artillery action tonight.
Entry.74: Face & eye improving. Be goodo in a couple of days time. The doctor came out & had lunch with us. Told me Kelynach was very near our H.Q. When we were getting our orders for the night the doc. wouldn't let me go out. Plenty of eggs dropped last night.
Entry.75: Face almost better. Can't shave yet but would like too. Boring day. Will go out to work tonight. Work cancelled on account of Tommys raiding at 9.30 pm & the
Entry.76: Bde raiding at 1.15 pm. Goodo. Played dominoes all day.
Entry.77: Some bombardment early this morning. Busy day again. The Colonel went out & had a look at our work tonight. Went to work myself & everything panned out well.
Entry.78: Things quiet again today. Saw a Fritzer machine come down last night in flames. Work as usual.
Entry.79:
Went for stroll today. Saw quite a lot of Yanks near here. Work as usual. Two boys

were injured with picks both in the left hand. All was quiet while we were out. But we had to leave at 1.30 am on account of a big stunt right along the line.
Entry.80:
The Yanks birthday. Gee we are celebrating it too. Very heavy barrage is being put up by our people. It started at 3.15 am sharp. Beautiful to look at. Hope everything turns out OK. Am just going to bed (3.30 am). It was some stunt I reckon. Went from one end of the Allied front to the other. Here on our sector everything was gained. The Corp got 850 prisoners besides 13 officers & a lot of machine guns.

Gee we nearly bought a fight tonight. About a quarter of an hour before we were to start out for work old Fritz started. Evidently a big counter attack. An S.O.S. went up & away our guns started. It was lovely to watch it. It stopped Fritz anyway as all the guns are quiet again after 2 hours or thereabouts of throwing iron at Fritz. No work tonight, but have to stand to in case of accidents. Fritz machines came over & bombed very near to our camp too. Will write to his people I think. Went to bed early for us (12 midnight).
Entry.81:
Scriven woke me about 2.30 to say Many Happy Returns. Old Fritz was stopped alright. Was cut up terribly & we then got prisoners. Went for a walk in the morning to see if we could get any information. Didn't get much so went out again after lunch & did well. Got a lot of news. Also had a game of rope quoit tennis. I enjoyed it immensely. Hope we can get some more soon. Came home & got 4 letters. Three from Mother & one wishing me many happy returns. Liked it immensely. Do me. Went out to work & did the usual while out & went up near the line & souvenired some china plates for the mess. We wanted them badly. Very close coming home. Got up a big sweat. Old fritz was

very windy all night. Thought we were going to stunt again. Gee he got thrashed some by our people on the 4th.
Entry.82: Had to get up early to take the men for a bath to La Houssoye. Perkins, Scriven & I managed to get a lorry to take them all down on condition we lent the artillery people 4 men to built them a dugout. Was a good idea as it saved a 6 mile tramp. Do me. Wrote 14 letters today. Francis & Harvey from the 32nd came & saw Scriven & I. My turn to stay home again tonight. Do me.
Entry.83: Very quiet all day, but just as we were going to work Fritz started with some heavy stuff. Got to the job all right & started but he stopped us for about ¾ of an hour. Lobbing very near. No casualties.
Entry.84: Arrived home at 4.15 am. Colored map & did odd things all day. Went to work as usual. A cpl. I sent out to look after tools shot himself in the arm (S.I.W.) McGowan saw him do it. His is under arrest. Fritz put over another lot of stuff & kept us 1/4 hr longer
Entry.85: Got home 3 a.m. We move back to C.Coy camp today & I have a rotten job of guarding forward bridges. Went round the bridges at 2 pm & took them over. Taking another & did one at Ville as well. Have 7 altogether now & gee it is some work. The one at Ville is the 4th b ridge on this site the other 3 having been blown up. Frtiz has direct observation on to it.
Entry.86:
Went round visiting the bridge guards. It is some distance too. The bridge at Mericourt was hit by a 9.2 this morning. Made a big smash in it too. No casualties tho. thank goodness. Weather is peculiar. It doesn't know whether to rain 

or be nice & sunny. It is a dismal failure at whatever it attempts.
Entry.87: Brekker in bed. Went over & saw Scriven. Fixed up dugout. Played cards as usual. Weather still the same. Plenty of thunder the last few days. Looks as if there is a big storm somewhere around.;
Entry.88: Took Edgley round to all the bridges. Had a lovely hot bath at one of the billets. Do me. Played cards. A big raid by the 15 Bgde came a crash last night. Got 1 killed & 4 wounded & never saw a Fritz. They had skedadaled
Entry.89:
Dads birthday today. Hope he is well. Nasty bleak old day here. My day at home today. Books arrived from Marie. Goods too. Did a bit of Pelmeanian.

A Fritzer came over & shot down 2 balloons about 9 pm. All the men in them came down safely in their parachutes. Also another balloons occupants came down before Fritz got them. Gee the Fritzer was game. Our Archies kept going at him but didn't do any good.

Bill Hepburn came round & saw me. He was here when the balloons wee shot down. Had a good old talk. He is now in the 32nd Battn. Have a cold on the chest.
Entry.90: Went round the bridges today. Everything is OK. Rained as usual. Seems to have a habit of raining every time I go out to the bridges. Had a sponge down & then took Scriven a bunch of flowers as it was his birthday. Cold isn't any better. Got Mac to give me a rub. Couldn't sleep some time. As soon as I came home from Scriven's place was told that I have to go out to the job at 8 am again tomorrow.
Entry.91:
Had some work today. Started at 8 am. Took Wilson & his platoon out to the bridges & then came here to this hole. Only did 11 miles altogether. 'A' Coy left this camp in a rotten state. Everything in the mens

dugouts were filthy. Ours are almost as bad. Didn't arrive here till about 2 pm. Actually saw a train today. Gee it is some sight too. Another balloon down soon after I landed here. Think Fritz must be going to attack here now. Looks very suspicious. Was quite right in my opinion as Fritz attacking cos he attacked at 5 am this morning down on the Trench line. Word just came through (8pm). Too hot to sleep tonight.
Entry.92: Have been with the battalion 3 months today. Went out to work. My job is to employ 18 men & a few NCO's daily on spreading metal at a water point down at Pont Noyelles (about ¾ mile away). No work down there today tho. Couldn't get any transport. Fixed it all up for tomorrow tho. Saw Archie Haddon down at the R.E. Dump. Had a good old talk. Repaired the dug out made it a little better. Can now move round in it. Some hot today. Had a big thunderestorm & tons or rain early this morning & now it is too hot to move. Went down to the canal & had a dip. Was bonny. Do me every time.
Entry.93: Still very hot. Had a shower or two last night but it doesn't cool the air a bit. It leaves it just as hot in the day time. Got a new wrist watch today from ordnance. Cost £ 1/3 & looks goodo. Couldn't be worse than the last anyway. Made the Major a bit annoyed today. Guess he will get over it all tho. one of these days. Got 4 magazines from Marie. She is a bonny sport. Do me. Got my new watch from Ordnance.
Entry.94: Plenty of work still. I played some RE cricket & won by 40 runs on first innings. Could have won by 5 wickets but it was too dark as pulled the boys out. Had my new watch absolutely smashed. No good to the business at all. Harry Moore & Raye came round to see me tonight.
Entry.95:
Lost out first cricket match this afternoon. Only beaten by 110 runs. Gee they were good. I made a duck. There is some big stunt on here by our people soon. We have to have a 2 days spell as I guess

we are well in it. S'pse it means digging a C.T. back from the new line. Went to a concert given by Yanks & it was goodo. So me every time. Enjoyed every item. Old Scriven came back with this platoon today.
Entry.96: Major left for a weeks leave at Paris Pleege. Played a company of the 48th Battn. cricket & beat them by 30 odd runs. Saw quite a lot of my old boys.
Entry.97: Froggies are still going some down Chattan Thiery way. Hope they keep going. Do us. Had a bit of fortune today. Went thro. tear gas to test our masks. Saw a fight between a Yank & an Aussie Won by the Yank on points. Was an 8 rounds affair. Got news of new stunt here. We have to go out & dig C.T. as soon as the Inf. have gone over.
Entry.98:
Mac Dick & Edgley went out early this morning to reconoitre the job but they found that the Stunt was off. Gee I'm glad too as it was a big thing for us. Meant digging 4 yards a man which is far too much for the time we would have had. Could only get about 2 hours good work in which wasn't enough. A Fritz

came over today & dropped another balloon. he was some sketchy too. Quite a lot of Fritzers over last night. They did some bombing. Scriven went back to his old dugout & job. Wilson came up from D Coy. & we took him to a concert in the wood given by 4th Brigade. It wasn't good. Saw quite a lot of old & had a talk to them.
Entry.99: Started on the water points again. Rained all day. Was a rotten day. Took over Secretary for the mess.
Entry.100: Perkins left to go on leave the Blighty. Played 51sdt Battery cricket & beat them by an innings & 13 runs. Should have attended a meeting today for the Sports & forgot, Colonel wanted to know why I wasn't there. Have 12 Yanks attached to the Coy. 3 of them went out with Sgt. Geult this morning to Mericourt.
Entry.101: Dear old Claire's birthday today. Had an extra job today. Our people put over a barrage this morning but no news has come thro at all about it. Only had a couple of showers today. The stunt is on again as we have to go out tomorrow to reconnoitre.
Entry.102:
Left at 8.45 to go up the line but is B.O.R. first & the Colonel told me off very politely about not attending the meeting the other day. Sent a message back for Holmes to go into the

meeting today in my place. Then went out. Gee its a long way too. Saw the job, Everything seemed very quiet on the job. Country looks well. Saw quite a lot of Fritz country. Get back at 4.30 pm & was very much chafed. Am going to try & play football in about an hours time as hope the other chap is better. Made the chap fitter by playing football. Had a bonny game & enjoyed myself immensely. Mac gave me a rubdown.
Entry.103: Rained all day. Did nothing cept reading. The Sergeant all went out & had a look at the work for the stunt.. Gee they were some wet too. Got the news that we move to Heilly tomorrow morning.
Entry.104:
quite a lot of Fritzers came over early this morning & did a lot of bombing. Didn't go near us tho moved to Heilly into 'A' Coys old place. They were just as dirty as usual too. At about 6 pm we got word that our big stunt was coming off & that we had to go out.

No 7 & 8 platoons were on one sap & no 5 & 6 on another. Well at 10 pm we all moved out. Tools were carried half way out for us. We collected them & then moved up thro the saps to the assembling point. Gee the C.T. was terrible, mud as deep as 2 feet & plenty of pools of water. We all got wet thro, & eventually reached out place at 11.30 om. At 12.30 am our barrage started.
Entry.105:
McGowan & Caley moved forward to lay the tape etc while I stayed behind to bring the platoons onto the job. Got a lot of backwash & No 7 2 corporals killed & one man wounded. I moved them all up & got them to the front line after much splashing & spluttering. Got the men on the job & paced it all out for them. Everything went well. Couldn't connect up to Fritz line cos we didn't have enough men. Edgley couldn' find his when everything was settled I went forward & found it for him. The second time I went out I brought in a Fritz machine gun. We left the job at 3.45 am having done 172 yds & leaving another 172 yds straight to do. Only got 1 boy wounded in my platoon. They all got home safely.

& I carried home my gun. We were all dead beat. Nos 5 & 6 couldn't find their job & so didn't do a thing.

Major MacLean took charge of the company after we got home on a/c of Edgley making such a mix up. We have to go out again tonight to complete & No 5 & 6 to start their job, I went out early with a runner to tape the remainder out. Got out early & did it with Stevenson Mac brought the 2 platoons down with him. I paced them all out & we got in a start (about 10.15 pm.) We just got down when Fritz got very shaky & sent over a lot of stuff & kept it up all night. We did 220 yds, marking total of 400 yds. Only had 1 casualty altho. The trench got 2 direct hits & a couple of boys got slight shell shocked.
Entry.106:
Finished the job about 2,30 am & came back home. Fritz did quite a lot of shelling all night & put over a lot of gas on the back areas. 

All dead tired. Major Wilkinson was home (back from Paris Playe) whenw e got back. Slept fairly well but mosquitoes stopped a lot of it. My second pip came out & dates deom 17.7.18. Was 18 month with 1 pip up. Everybody in the company finished their job. Our total casualties for the two nights was 6 killed 9 wounded.

We move back for Bussy tomorrow morning for 10 days spell. Went to be early after writing 2 letters.
Entry.107:
Our move was changed form Bussy to Querrien as the 4th Pioneers hadn't left Bussy. The 4th. Div are taking over a sector from the Froggies. Tommies are relieving us. They come up 

 

to take over our billets & then we move out. It was at 2 pm. Gee it is some hot too marching these days. We did about 8000 yds from Hilly to Querrien, Got here OK & went into billets. We move to Bussy tomorrow. Passed 150 charabancs, lorries buses etc. They had evidently conveyed the whole Tommy division up here from some other place

Climbed trees & picked green apples. Guess we have a picnic tomorrow. Had a feed of stewed apples for dinner. Gee they were good, We move to Bussy tomorrow morning. Will start a new book tomorrow.
